snippet: Following Rolling Stone’s account of a gang rape at the school, its president, Teresa A. Sullivan, has been trying to navigate a path that has shifted by the day.
abstract: Students and administrators at University of Virginia continue to struggle with fallout from Rolling Stone magazine article that purported to describe gang rape at fraternity house on campus; article has since come under fire for reporting flaws and most people on campus are now withholding comment until more facts emerge.

byline.contributor: Richard Perez-Pena contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Following Rolling Stone’s account of a gang rape at the school, its president, Teresa A. Sullivan, has been trying to navigate a path that has shifted by the day.

headline.main: Students and Leaders Grapple With Crisis on University of Virginia Campus
headline.print_headline: Students and Leaders Grapple With Crisis on a Virginia Campus
